metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7638 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SDL (Simple DirectMedia Layer) through 1.2.15 and 2.x through 2.0.9 has a heap-based buffer over-read in Map1toN in video/SDL_pixels.c. USN-4143-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL 2.0. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl1.2debian - 1.2.15+dfsg2-0.1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libsdl2-2.0-0 - 2.0.8+dfsg1-1ubuntu1.18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl1.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.15+dfsg2-0.1ubuntu0.1').
libsdl2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.8+dfsg1-1ubuntu1.18.04.4').
